meanings.definition: A small stalk bearing a single flower in an inflorescence.
meanings.sent1: The pedicels of the daisy held the delicate petals.
meanings.sent2: The rose bouquet had pedicels that connected each bloom.
meanings.sent3: The pedicels of the sunflower danced in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The pedicels of the orchid reached out like tiny fingers.
meanings.sent5: The pedicels swayed gently under the weight of the blossom.

meanings.definition: A slender stalk supporting a single flower in a compound inflorescence.
meanings.sent1: Each pedicel of the lilac cluster held a fragrant bloom.
meanings.sent2: The pedicels of the hydrangea were adorned with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The pedicels of the daffodil stood tall and proud.
meanings.sent4: The pedicels intertwined like a delicate web of nature's beauty.
meanings.sent5: The pedicels gracefully displayed the cluster of blossoms.
